etymology.description: 菠萝 + 包 = pineapple + bun → a sweet bun with a pineapple-like crust.
etymology.interpretation: Named for its pineapple-like crackled crust; classic versions contain no actual pineapple.
etymology.simplification: Only 蘿 → 萝 was simplified by replacing 羅 with 罗 under the grass radical, reducing strokes; 菠 and 包 are unchanged.

parts.english: bun; bread roll; bag; to wrap

examples.chinese: 我最喜欢早餐吃菠萝包(我最喜歡早餐吃菠蘿包)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ zuì xǐhuan zǎocān chī bōluóbāo.
examples.english: I love eating pineapple buns for breakfast.

examples.chinese: 香港的面包店常卖热腾腾的菠萝包(香港的麵包店常賣熱騰騰的菠蘿包)。
examples.pinyin: Xiānggǎng de miànbāo diàn cháng mài rè téngténg de bōluóbāo.
examples.english: Bakeries in Hong Kong often sell steaming-hot pineapple buns.

examples.chinese: 它的表皮像菠萝但通常不含菠萝馅(它的表皮像菠蘿但通常不含菠蘿餡)。
examples.pinyin: Tā de biǎopí xiàng bōluó dàn tōngcháng bù hán bōluó xiàn.
examples.english: Its crust looks like a pineapple, but it usually has no pineapple filling.
